alert.note: Alert for Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 4:51PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Douglas, northwestern Elbert and southwestern Arapahoe Counties through 515 PM MDT... At 451 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout tornado along a line extending from 11 miles northeast of Ponderosa Park to near Louviers, or along a line extending from 46 miles west of Limon to 15 miles south of Denver. Movement was north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts possible and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Landspout tornadoes can damage mobile homes, roofs, vehicles, and trees. Outdoor objects may be tossed about. Locations impacted include... Southern Aurora, southern Centennial, Highlands Ranch, Parker, eastern Littleton, Lone Tree, Castle Pines, Louviers, Sedalia and The Pinery. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If a tornado is spotted seek shelter inside a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for northeastern and east central Colorado.

area.areaDesc: Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County
